chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
4:00 PM
Defendant Christopher W. Wilson appeared by video.  Attorney Adam Thomas Witt in court for Christopher W. Wilson.  Attorney Corinne L Frutiger in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Witt informs the court their client wishes to waive his right to preliminary hearing.
Court informs the defendant of his right to preliminary hearing and purpose of said hearing.
Court questions defendant re: his right to preliminary hearing.
Court questions counsel re: his clients waiver of preliminary hearing.
Court finds waiver of preliminary is made freely, knowingly & voluntarily.
Court accepts waiver and orders bind over. 

State files information.
Formal reading is waived.

Defendant enters plea of "NOT GUILTY"
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 15, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Scheduling conference on November 15, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Amend bond to no controlled substances or paraphernalia

Shall not posession OR consume any controlled substances without valid prescription. SHALL NOT OPERATE
A MV WITHOU A VALID LICENSE
Defendant shall not possess any nonprescription controlled substances, or any prescription medicine for which the defendant does not have a current prescription.
Defendant shall not possess any paraphernalia.
Defendant shall not drive without a valid drivers license.
